alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ada, southwestern Boise and south central Gem Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 349 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eagle, or 9 miles northwest of Boise, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Boise, Meridian, Eagle, Garden City, Star, Placerville, Firebird Speedway, Harris Creek Summit, Hidden Springs and Bogus Basin Ski Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Treasure Valley
